content.webTitle: Oh please, Dad. Not the Isle of Dogs again!

fields.headline: Oh please, Dad. Not the Isle of Dogs again!
fields.bodyText: Here buoyant! Dogs might love water, but take them on a boat and there's a danger they could fall overboard and get lost in the waves. Cue the doggie flotation device (pictured right) from Outward Hound at Harrods (020 7730 1234), which comes in fluorescent orange with a handle on top for easy visibility and rescue. It comes in three sizes for everything from a terrier to a labrador and costs £39.95. If hiking's more your thing but man's best friend just can't keep up with you, try the dog backpack from the same range. They cost £72.95 and come complete with removable pack to store canine refreshments. Pack leader How many times have you taken the dog for a trip only to find you've forgotten water, bowl or food? You get the lot with this Pet Travel Kit, along with a stay-cool pack and poop-scoop bags. It costs £10.99 plus postage from Hoseasons (0870 333 2000), which takes pets in most of its holiday parks and cottages. Fun on four legs Country dancing and canoeing for man and beast? Dog-Days Activity Holidays (01333 312260) says it's not just people who want more varied activities on holiday. So instead of booking Rover into the kennel, take him up to North East Fife on a five-day break which includes 'off-lead' time with other dogs. It costs £225 including activities, snacks and lunch for dogs and owners. Accommodation is extra but can be recommended on a one-to-five bone scale. Bone idle Check into the five-star Hotel Lancaster in Paris and your four-legged friend gets to lay down his head on a tobacco-coloured faux ostrich and stainless steel bed for £62 a night (humans cost £264). Contact 0033 1 40 764076. Do you take this bitch...? It could only happen in America - a Canine Commitment Ceremony for two amorous pooches.The Caliente Tropics Resort (001 760 327 1391) in Palm Springs includes the ceremony, complete with veil for her and bow tie for him, as part of a room package starting at £175 a night for two humans and two pets. In this case 'I do' is replaced by 'woof woof'. The bridal pair also get a doggie turn-down service, with pigs' ears left out for them. For the pampered pooch The lucky mutts who get taken to The Fonteverde Spa Hotel in Siena, Italy, can plunge into their own thermal pool, where the waters are said to help everything from arthritis to skin disorders. They also get designer dog robes, gourmetpet food and a supervised play area. Pets cost from £17 a day, owners pay £1,100pp for seven days' full board including flights and treatments with Essential Escapes (020 7284 3344).
